resources.string: Northrop Loom: In the 1890s, the Northrop Loom became popular due to its fully automatic features, significantly improving weaving efficiency.
Draper Loom: During the early 20th century, the Draper loom was widely used, known for its high speed and efficiency in producing woven fabrics.

Projectile loom: The projectile weaving machine was invented by Sulzer in 1952 in Switzerland. Here, the weft yarn is inserted in a projectile. These looms are very flexible and suitable for universal use.
Circular loom: The weft yarns are simultaneously interlaced with many warp yarns. These looms can be used to make tubular fabrics.
Water jet loom: The weaving is done by the yarn carried by the water jet. These looms are very fast.
Air-jet loom: The weaving is done by the yarn carried by the air jet. These looms are very fast.
Rapier Loom: The weaving is done by the rapier. The rapier is like a solid stick, which carries the weft yarn.
The Rapier Loom: The Rapier Loom can be divided into two types: single rapier loom and double rapier loom. These are the best loom to make any kind of yarn dyed fabric.
The Rapier Loom was mostly used in the textile industries. The loom was mostly imported from Russia, so no new technology was developed during this time.
